intro: Sericocalyx celebicus var. calcitrapa, commonly known as the calcite-trap sericocalyx, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy foliage and a woody stem, adapted to its tropical environment. It thrives in shaded, moist habitats and is often found in limestone-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
